references.paper_title: Git re-basin: Merging models modulo permutation symmetries
references.reason: This paper introduces a method for aligning neurons between pre-trained models before weight interpolation, addressing a key challenge in model merging which is relevant to the proposed Deep Graph Mating approach.

references.paper_title: Distilling knowledge from graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This foundational paper introduces Knowledge Distillation for GNNs, upon which much of the existing research on GNN reuse is built, including the proposed GRAMA approach.

references.paper_title: Amalgamating knowledge from heterogeneous graph neural networks
references.reason: This paper introduces Knowledge Amalgamation for GNNs, extending the scope of Knowledge Distillation to multiple teacher models, which is directly related to the proposed Deep Graph Mating approach.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This highly influential paper introduces Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs), a fundamental architecture in graph neural networks that is used extensively in the experiments of the proposed GRAMA approach.
This influential paper introduces Graph Attention Networks (GATs), another important architecture in graph neural networks that is used in the experiments of the proposed GRAMA approach.
